intro: Thalictrum scabrifolium, commonly known as roughleaf meadow rue, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, serrated leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces showy, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It typically grows in moist, woodland habitats and prefers partial to full shade. Thalictrum scabrifolium is often used in native plant gardens for its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
